div.p: In accordance with Governor Cuomo’s directive, CQA will remain closed and continue distance learning, until May 15th at the earliest. Scholars and families may find academic information on our “Scholars and Families” page.
Please see the bottom of this page for COVID-19 information and resources.

h3.strong: In these times, how we enact our core values -- ﻿Care for Community, Quality of Character, and Achievement through Academics -- becomes most urgent and real.

div.p: Thank you to the many of you who've been in touch to ask how to help CQA as we face the impact of COVID-19. Currently, we have no confirmed cases but took the precautionary step of closing CQA through April 20, 2020, at the earliest.

In these times, how we enact our core values -- Care for Community, Quality of Character, and Achievement through Academics -- becomes most urgent and real. We've focused first on caring for our young scholars and families, and our beloved staff, by moving to distance learning and working.

Beginning on March 19, CQA's 400+ scholars will move their learning to online, guided by our 50+ teachers, administrators and counselors at each step. Under CQA School Director Glenn Liebeck's extraordinary leadership, our instructional staff will provide all teaching, including small group instruction, and our distinctive services like office hours and homework tutoring, each week. Our counseling and intervention staff will offer counseling and advisory to ensure our scholars have social and emotional support during the challenging days and weeks ahead. Thanks to the City of New York, our children will have access to two school meals each day. We will strive for as much continuity in these fluid circumstances as possible.

Our school stands with the rest of the world in the faith and optimism that normalcy will return soon with minimal harm. Our diversity of experiences in these challenging days ahead will only reveal and bring forth our collective strength as a unified school community.
If and when there is a way for the greater circle of CQA supporters like you to help, we will not hesitate to reach out.
We will stay distant without disconnecting, and I hope you will do the same. Wishing you and your loved ones health and safety.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p:
Suyin So
Founder and Executive Director
Central Queens Academy Charter School

h2.strong:
Information on COVID-19 and
assistance programs and resources

h3.br:
COVID-19 Resources and Information:
New York State Department of Health: Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Center for Disease Control: Coronavirus Disease 2019
New York City Department of Health
Talking with children about the coronavirus

div.h3:
free meals:
NYC Department of education is providing free grab-and-go meals for every New Yorker. Meals are distributed from hundreds of meal hubs at school buildings around the city and are free to adults and children. No id required, no questions asked and no registration needed. find a distribution site by clicking here.
Additional meal assistance information can be found by clicking here.

Assistance for NYC residents:
Click here For information on unemployment, housing, healthcare, food and other assistance and resources for NYC residents.

h3.br:
sign up for New York state COVID-19 updates.
resources for immigrant families:
click here to see if you qualify for any of the supportive resources available to immigrant and undocumented families.
Scholars and families:
please Click on the “Scholars and Families” page for distance learning information and homework.
